H0.text: Neutrons are the particles whose differing numbers allow atoms of the same element to have different atomic masses.

H1.text: Protons are the numbers that atoms of the same element can have different numbers of, leading to different atomic masses.

H2.text: Electrons are the particles that atoms of the same element can have different numbers of, which leads to different atomic masses.

H3.text: Neutrinos are the particles that atoms of the same element can have different numbers of, which causes the atoms to exhibit different atomic masses.

A4.text: The nuclei of different isotopes for a given element have different numbers of neutrons, albeit having the same number of protons.

A5.text: A neutral atom has the same number of electrons as protons. Thus different isotopes of a given element all have the same number of electrons...
